Constructor Detail

LFUCache

public LFUCache()
Creates an instance of the LFUCache object to cache objects. The cache is set to the default maximum size.

LFUCache

public LFUCache(int maxSize)
Creates an instance of the LFUCache object to cache object up to the given max size before it enforces the Least Recently Used replacement strategy. If the max size is set to 0, then the default value of CacheIF.DEFAULT_CACHE_SIZE (1024) is used.
Parameters:
maxSize - is an integer specifying the number of cached objects that can exists in the cache at any given time.

LFUCache

public LFUCache(CacheIF oldCache)
Copy constructor. Creates an instance of the LFUCache class from an existing CacheIF object, copy the contents of the old cache to this cache. This constructor is for the purpose of switching caching strategies at runtime.
Parameters:
cache:LCacheIF - object containing the cached objects.
Method Detail

purgeCache

protected void purgeCache()
purgeCache using the Least Frequently Used algorithm to clean the cache of CacheableIF objects that have expired, are no longer valid, and when the cache is near peak size.
Overrides:
purgeCache in class AbstractCache

containsCacheable

public boolean containsCacheable(CacheableIF cacheObject)
containsCacheable searches the cache for the cacheObject parameter and returns true if the CacheableIF object exists, false otherwise.
Overrides:
containsCacheable in class AbstractCache
Parameters:
cacheObject:L.CacheableIF - object used in determining existence in this cache.
Returns:
a boolean value indicating whether the cacheObject exists in this cache or not.

containsKey

public boolean containsKey(java.lang.String key)
containsKey searches the cache for the key parameter and returns true if the key maps to a CacheableIF object in this cache.
Overrides:
containsKey in class AbstractCache
Parameters:
key:Ljava.lang.String - object in question of whether it maps to a CacheableIF object.
Returns:
a boolean value indicating whether the key maps to a CacheableIF object or not.

getCacheables

public java.util.Iterator getCacheables()
getCacheables returns an Iterator object over the CacheableIF objects in this cache.
Returns:
a java.util.Iterator object used in iterating over all CacheableIF objects in the cache.

getKeys

public java.util.Iterator getKeys()
getKeys returns an Iterator object over the keys that map to CacheableIF objects in this cache.
Returns:
a java.util.Iterator object iterating over all keys in the cache mapping to CacheableIF objects.

getMaxSize

public int getMaxSize()
getMaxSize returns the maximum number of CacheableIF objects that this cache will hold.
Returns:
in integer value of the cache's maximum size (buckets).

getSize

public int getSize()
getSize returns the current size of the cache. The size of the cache is determined by the number of CacheableIF objects cached in this cache at any given time.
Returns:
a integer value specifying the current size of the cache.

readCacheable

public CacheableIF readCacheable(java.lang.String key)
readCacheable returns a CacheableIF object that is referenced in the cache by the key parameter. If the key is null, or if the key does not refer to a CacheableIF object, than null is returned. If the CacheableIF object exists but is no longer valid or has expired, than the CacheablIF object's refresh method is called. If the refresh succeeds, then the CacheableIF object is returned, otherwise null is returned and the CacheableIF object is removed from the cache.
Parameters:
key:Ljava.lang.String - object referring to the CacheableIF object of interests in cache.
Returns:
a L.CacheableIF object referred to by the key parameter, or null if it does not refer to a CacheableIF object.

setMaxSize

public void setMaxSize(int maxSize)
setMaxSize sets the maximum number of CacheableIF objects that can be contained in this cache (number of buckets).
Parameters:
maxSize - is an integer value specifying the maximum number of CacheableIF objects (buckets) to store in this cache.

writeCacheable

public void writeCacheable(CacheableIF cacheObject)
writeCacheable stores the specified CacheableIF object in this cache.
Parameters:
cacheObject:L.CacheableIF - object to store in this cache and to be shared by other modules of the application.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the key (unique identifier) of this CacheableIF object is null.
See Also:
CacheableIF.getID()

writeCacheable

public void writeCacheable(java.lang.String key,
                           CacheableIF cacheObject)
writeCacheable stores the specified CacheableIF object in this cache, referenced by the key parameter.
Parameters:
cacheObject:L.CacheableIF - object to store in this cache and to be shared by other modules of the application.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the key (unique identifier) parameter is null.
